p: Thymol (5-methyl-2-propan-2-ylphenol) ( Figure 12) is a monoterpene found in certain plant species such as thyme [ 103]. It has proven pharmacological activities such as antioxidant [ 104], anti-inflammatory [ 105], analgesic [ 106], antibacterial [ 107], antifungal [ 108], and antitumor [ 109].
